verses.plain: He that revengeth shall find vengeance from the Lord, and he will surely keep his sins in remembrance.

tokens.t: He that revengeth shall find vengeance from the Lord, and he will surely keep his sins

verses.plain: Forgive thy neighbour the hurt that he hath done unto thee, so shall thy sins also be forgiven when thou prayest.

tokens.t: Forgive thy neighbour the hurt that he hath done unto thee, so shall thy sins also be forgiven when thou prayest.

verses.plain: One man beareth hatred against another, and doth he seek pardon from the Lord?

tokens.t: One man beareth hatred against another, and doth he seek pardon from the Lord?

verses.plain: He sheweth no mercy to a man, which is like himself: and doth he ask forgiveness of his own sins?

tokens.t: He sheweth no mercy to a man, which is like himself: and doth he ask forgiveness of his own sins?

verses.plain: If he that is but flesh nourish hatred, who will intreat for pardon of his sins?

tokens.t: If he that is but flesh nourish hatred, who will intreat for pardon of his sins?

verses.plain: Remember thy end, and let enmity cease; remember corruption and death, and abide in the commandments.

tokens.t: Remember thy end, and let enmity cease;
corruption and death, and abide in the commandments.

verses.plain: Remember the commandments, and bear no malice to thy neighbour: remember the covenant of the Highest, and wink at ignorance.

tokens.t: Remember the commandments, and bear no malice to thy neighbour:
the covenant of the Highest, and wink at ignorance.

verses.plain: Abstain from strife, and thou shalt diminish thy sins: for a furious man will kindle strife,

tokens.t: Abstain from strife, and thou shalt diminish thy sins: for a furious man will kindle strife,

verses.plain: A sinful man disquieteth friends, and maketh debate among them that be at peace.

tokens.t: A sinful man disquieteth friends, and maketh debate among them that be at peace.

verses.plain: As the matter of the fire is, so it burneth: and as a man’s strength is, so is his wrath; and according to his riches his anger riseth; and the stronger they are which contend, the more they will be inflamed.

tokens.t: As the matter of the fire is, so it burneth: and as a man’s strength is, so is his wrath; and according to his riches his anger riseth; and the stronger they are which contend, the more they will be inflamed.

verses.plain: An hasty contention kindleth a fire: and an hasty fighting sheddeth blood.

tokens.t: An hasty contention kindleth a fire: and an hasty fighting sheddeth blood.

verses.plain: If thou blow the spark, it shall burn: if thou spit upon it, it shall be quenched: and both these come out of thy mouth.

tokens.t: If thou blow the spark, it shall burn: if thou spit upon it, it shall be quenched: and both these come out of thy mouth.

verses.plain: Curse the whisperer and doubletongued: for such have destroyed many that were at peace.

tokens.t: Curse the whisperer and doubletongued: for such have destroyed many that were at peace.

verses.plain: A backbiting tongue hath disquieted many, and driven them from nation to nation: strong cities hath it pulled down, and overthrown the houses of great men.

tokens.t: A backbiting tongue hath disquieted many, and driven them from nation to nation: strong cities hath it pulled down, and overthrown the houses of great men.

verses.plain: A backbiting tongue hath cast out virtuous women, and deprived them of their labours.

tokens.t: A backbiting tongue hath cast out virtuous women, and deprived them of their labours.

verses.plain: Whoso hearkeneth unto it shall never find rest, and never dwell quietly.

tokens.t: Whoso hearkeneth unto it shall never find rest, and never dwell quietly.

verses.plain: The stroke of the whip maketh marks in the flesh: but the stroke of the tongue breaketh the bones.

tokens.t: The stroke of the whip maketh marks in the flesh: but the stroke of the tongue breaketh the bones.

verses.plain: Many have fallen by the edge of the sword: but not so many as have fallen by the tongue.

tokens.t: Many have fallen by the edge of the sword: but not so many as have fallen by the tongue.

verses.plain: Well is he that is defended through the venom thereof; who hath not drawn the yoke thereof, nor hath been bound in her bands.

tokens.t: Well is he that is defended through the venom thereof; who hath not drawn the yoke thereof, nor hath been bound in her bands.

verses.plain: For the yoke thereof is a yoke of iron, and the bands thereof are bands of brass.

tokens.t: For the yoke thereof is a yoke of iron, and the bands thereof are bands of brass.

verses.plain: The death thereof is an evil death, the grave were better than it.

tokens.t: The death thereof is an evil death, the grave were better than it.

verses.plain: It shall not have rule over them that fear God, neither shall they be burned with the flame thereof.

tokens.t: It shall not have rule over them that fear God, neither shall they be burned with the flame thereof.

verses.plain: Such as forsake the Lord shall fall into it; and it shall burn in them, and not be quenched; it shall be sent upon them as a lion, and devour them as a leopard.

tokens.t: Such as forsake the Lord shall fall into it; and it shall burn in them, and not be quenched; it shall be sent upon them as a lion, and devour them as a leopard.

verses.plain: Look that thou hedge thy possession about with thorns, and bind up thy silver and gold,

tokens.t: Look that thou hedge thy possession about with thorns, and bind up thy silver and gold,

verses.plain: And weigh thy words in a balance, and make a door and bar for thy mouth.

tokens.t: And weigh thy words in a balance, and make a door and bar for thy mouth.

verses.plain: Beware thou slide not by it, lest thou fall before him that lieth in wait.

tokens.t: Beware thou slide not by it, lest thou fall before him that lieth in wait.
